result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Carlos Richard Talbert

records.addlTxt: Pretrial Services Status Report- 09-01-2022, filed. rmm
filed and forwarded to judge.  rmm
Justice Point Violation Report forwarded to Judge for review and filed.

Defendant Carlos Richard Talbert in court with attorney Matthew V Plummer.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Hearing held via zoom. HEARING HELD OFF THE RECORD. Status conference held. Attorney Plummer has discovery and an offer and is requesting trial dates.  Court orders any pretrial documents be filed no later than 48 hours before the final pretrial date. Case is adjourned to Br. 1.  Final pre-trial scheduled for November 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Matthew V Plummer in court.  Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
Case calendared for Status Conference this date.  Defendant was ill and to appear via Zoom.  Court does not have a reporter this morning.  Matter adjourned.  Status conference scheduled for July 27, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report 6-13-2022, filed.  rmm

Defendant Carlos Richard Talbert in court via Zoom with attorney Matthew V Plummer.  
Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Pretrial conference held.  Atty. Plummer has received and offer, but not discovery and requests a status date.  Case is adjourned to Br. 1.  Status conference scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report 5-16-2022, filed.  rmm

22RM023800  Actual Date Bond Posted with * Sheriff
4/30/2022

Court ordered no possession or use of any dangerous weapons or firearms.
Court orders defendant TO JUSTICE POINT for Level 3 supervision.  If he can't post the cash bail he will be TOT to Justice Point. 
IF THE DEFENDANT FAILS TO REPORT A WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Ken H.
No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Court ordered arrest warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.

Defendant Carlos Richard Talbert in court.  Paul Leonard Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Davila, Branch 01.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 01 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 16, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
